result.execSummary:
The defendant Roland Manriquez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: PROBATION REVIEW HEARING NOVEMBER 7, 2014 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges including DNA and DV surcharges of this case; including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by DOC.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Bail to apply.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violationg the No Contact Order,  and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms.

No contact with victim unless the victim requests contact and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
No firearms; weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Pay all supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review hrg.***Feb.13, review: It i ORDERED to issue a commitment forthwith to take defendant into custody for 20 days straight time, no good time credit as a condition of non-compliance of probation conditions.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roland Manriquez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roland Manriquez in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is needed.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim notification made.  Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Sentencing proceeded.

  Defendant sentenced to serve 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 11/07/2014.   
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention".
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV surcharge) of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Bail on deposit to be applied.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.

Received and filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 7, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney John Matthew Krejci.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNTS 1,2,3,4,5,6,8,9,10,11:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charges dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.
*
AS TO COUNT 7:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney John M Krejci.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 7/28/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney John M Krejci.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of West Allis Police Officer Wayne Treet.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court will take 14CM190 and 14CM668 from Branch 4 so all cases can be resolved together.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CF1506, 14CM190 and 14CM668 joined for the purpose of trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hannah O and her children; Joshua M or Tina G

Defendant Roland Manriquez in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Roland Manriquez in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary Hearing to be heard by Judge Grady for Judge Flanagan.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
